body:
Comment 5: 
There's no point in implementing the general case of tail call optimization
when we're not going to use it for general code (and we're not). The only
place this comes up is in the embedded trampoline generator. I am sorry you
tripped over it, but it is a tiny special case, not a big one. I count 200
lines, maybe another 100 if it gets implemented in 5g. I doubt very much
that the amount of code you would have to add throughout the toolchain for
tail call optimization would be smaller than 300 lines.
